titlepage.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory to the Bertram L. Cadwalader Papers, 1918-1929
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 2000 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Writings, notes, and memoranda, relating to demoralization in the French army in 1917, the German offensive and Allied counteroffensive of 1918, and the decision to create an independent United States Army command on the Western front.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Bertram L. Cadwalader Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

controlaccess.head: Access Points
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Army. American Expeditionary Forces.
controlaccess.subject: World War, 1914-1918.
World War, 1914-1918--Campaigns--France.

did.unittitle: "The Struggle for an American Army and why the 91st Division... Became a Front-Line Combat Unit..."
Notes, 1925, from Reichsarchiv, on German Armies (goes with material on Germany)
Excerpts from letter, 1910 August 31, re Meuse, etc.
Copy of report from Gen. Ragueneau to Commander-in-Chief of N. & N. E. [No. 7.002/C.A.], 1918 March 6
Copy of memorandum by Pétain on Instruction of American Infantry Units Attached to Large French Units, 1918 May 1,
Handwritten memorandum, 1918 June 22, from Col. Fox Connor, Assistant Chief of G-3 for Information Of Chief of Staff re memorandum of Gen. Pershing of 1918 June 21
Copies of memoranda, 1918 June-September (39 pages) re Third Secretary G. S., Chiefs of Staff, etc. (Foch, Pershing, Weygand - Conference at Bombon)
